questions.question_text: True or False: Snowflake enforces unique, primary key, and foreign key constraints during DML operations.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Snowflake supports defining and maintaining constraints, but does not enforce them, except for NOT NULL constraints, which are always enforced.

Selected Answer: B
Only NOT NULL is enforced.
https://docs.snowflake.com/en/sql-reference/constraints.html
It doesn't enforce.. But Not null is

Selected Answer: AB
I have checked in SNOWFLAKE documentation. Only the first two are available. My answer is A & B

Selected Answer: AB
Snowflake does not have an IS_XML function. While Snowflake can store XML-like structures in VARIANT columns, the format isn't natively checked as XML.

This cannot be. How will you share outside the Region and Cloud Provider. You will need to replicate the data. I would say that share is about same account.

questions.question_text: How can data be shared between two users who have different Snowflake accounts?

choices.D: Use the PUT command to create a shared account.
choices.C: Ensure both usersâ€™ accounts are using the same cloud provider and region.
choices.A: Create a share with the same name as the original database.
choices.B: Create a share and ensure the proper role is assigned to the share.

questions.question_text:
A user executed a SELECT query in Snowsight which returned a 1 GB result set. The user then downloads the files.

What will occur?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B - Snowflake apply compression and splits data into multiple files

Selected Answer: B
First of all, 1 GB is not good. It is by default divided in 16 MB files, and compressed, I suppose.

choices.C: The download will fail because the result set needs to be broken up into files no greater than 50 MB before downloading.
choices.A: The result set will be successfully downloaded from Snowsight.
choices.B: The result set will be automatically compressed and the data will be downloaded as individual files.
choices.D: The download will result in an error because the filters of the SELECT query need to be changed so that Snowsight returns a smaller result set.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D is correct

comments.content: COPY INTO (table) is for loading to tables, only
